title: Ghost Become First Hard Rock Act to Go No. 1 on Billboard in Four Years
description: Skeletá also had the biggest vinyl sales week of any hard rock album in modern history. Ghost Become First Hard Rock Act to Go No. 1 on Billboard in Four Years Scoop Harrison
author: Scoop Harrison
excerpt: Skeletá also had the biggest vinyl sales week of any hard rock album in modern history.
text: Ghost have become the hard rock act in four years to top the Billboard 200 albums chart. Their latest record, Skeletá, debut this week at No. 1, topping releases by SZA, Kendrick Lamar, Morgan Wallen, Bad Bunny, and more. Get Ghost Tickets Here Perhaps most impressive, of the 86,000 equivalent album units moved by Skeletá in its first week of release, 89% of that total was driven by traditional album sales, including 44,000 vinyl copies sold. According to Billboard, that 44,000 number not only marks the biggest vinyl sales week for a hard rock album in the modern era (since tracking began in 1991), but it’s the third largest sales week of vinyl in the modern era for any rock album, trailing only blink-182’s One More Time… (49,000 in 2023) and boygenius’ The Record (45,000 in 2023). Skeletá is the first hard rock album to go No. 1 on the Billboard 200 since AC/DC’s Power Up in 2020. It terms of general rock releases, Coldplay’s Moon Music was the last album to top the chart in October 2024. Ghost will support Skeletá by embarking on a US arena tour this summer; get tickets here. Ghost have become the hard rock act in four years to top the Billboard 200 albums chart. Their latest record, Skeletá, debut this week at No. 1, topping releases by SZA, Kendrick Lamar, Morgan Wallen, Bad Bunny, and more.

Get Ghost Tickets Here

Perhaps most impressive, of the 86,000 equivalent album units moved by Skeletá in its first week of release, 89% of that total was driven by traditional album sales, including 44,000 vinyl copies sold. According to Billboard, that 44,000 number not only marks the biggest vinyl sales week for a hard rock album in the modern era (since tracking began in 1991), but it’s the third largest sales week of vinyl in the modern era for any rock album, trailing only blink-182’s One More Time… (49,000 in 2023) and boygenius’ The Record (45,000 in 2023).

Skeletá is the first hard rock album to go No. 1 on the Billboard 200 since AC/DC’s Power Up in 2020. It terms of general rock releases, Coldplay’s Moon Music was the last album to top the chart in October 2024.

Ghost will support Skeletá by embarking on a US arena tour this summer; get tickets here.
